conditions: 6 AM— If you're looking for a Friday sensation to fuel your sense of fascination, look no further than a ride to heightened elevation. Panoramic vistas framed by sapphire skies await your creative daydreams as abundant sunshine continues to rule overhead. Cooler temperatures will top out in the low teens at the summit and in the mid-20s in the Village. Expect your carving contrails to linger a little longer, as moderate north-northwest winds gusting between 5 and 25 mph spin the crystals skyward. It's close enough to the weekend. So, ditch out on the oppressive workplace drudgery and let Rendezvous Mountain take you on a liberating voyage of personal discovery. -Lege

6 AM—Welcome to the weekend, all you fall-line fanatics. It's time to harness a little bit of "get up and go" because the classic combo of an indigo sky above surreal, wind-sculpted snow is poised to put on another alpine light show. Whether you're totally green or somewhere beyond advanced, the draw of Rendezvous' refracted solar rays will leave you feeling oddly entranced. Cool mountain temperatures will top out around 20 outside Corbet's Cabin and near 30 in Teton Village. Diminishing northwest winds will largely blow in the 5-15 mph range following higher morning gusts. Ultimately, Saturdays were made for all to enjoy. So, grab whatever carving tool you prefer to employ, and let the mountain be your Gentle Giant toy. -Lege
